title: Man stabbed to death ‘after fight in the street in London’
text:
Share this article via flipboard

Share this article via email

Share this article via messenger

Police forensics officers at the scene of a fatal stabbing on Barnehurst Avenue, in Bexley (Picture: LNP; PA)

A man, 20, has died after being stabbed in the chest this afternoon.

Police said they were called to reports of males fighting in the street at 2.48pm.

They found a man suffering from stab wounds on Barnehurst Avenue, Bexley, south east London.

The man was taken to an east London hospital but died at 5.27pm, a Metropolitan Police spokesman said.

A 17-year-old boy has been arrested and remains in custody.

The man’s next of kin have been informed but formal identification has not yet taken place.

Caption: Police forensics officers at the scene of a fatal stabbing on Barnehurst Avenue (Picture: PA)

Police officers have closed off a road in Bexley, South East London (Picture: LNP)

Forensics outside a property in Bexley (Picture: LNP)

Police officers have closed off a road in Bexley. It is unknown if a car accident is related to the stabbing (Picture: LNP)

It happened in Bexley, south east London (Picture: Google)

A post-mortem examination will be held in due course, police said.

Police said inquiries into the circumstances of the stabbing continue.

Anyone who has information is asked to call 101 ref CAD 4418/13 Oct.
